name: Iberostar Dominicana Hotel

reviews.text: Imagine flying to another country, trying to check in at the front desk and being turned away because they don't have your reservation on file. Not just that, but for the hotel staff not to offer any solution or help in trying to resolve the issue. That's exactly what happened to me at the Iberostar Dominicana. We booked through a tour company and received a confirmation on the flight, transfers and hotel. Everyone else seemed to have our information with no questions asked, but apparently the hotel had no reservation for us, and claimed all of their 3 resorts were totally booked. I find that impossible to believe. After we had them talk to the tour company for a couple hours, they still didn't offer us a room. They didn't even apologize or do anything to help us find other accomodations. To make a long story short, they were rude, very impersonal and caused us to waste our entire first afternoon of our vacation. We asked the tour company to find us another hotel and they did. We ended up staying at the Majestic Colonial Punta Cana, a more luxurious resort which turned out to be great. Never again will I stay at an Iberostar or recommend one to friends or family. Nothing like this has ever happened to me. In terms of terrible hotel service, I can't think of too many things that beat this experience.
reviews.title: Terrible experience and reservation mix up!

reviews.text: After visiting Mexico for 7 straight years, our group (11 this year) decided to venture into the Dominican Republic. Nine of us stayed the the Dominicana, two stayed the the Punta Cana Iberostar. Even though were were in two different hotels, you couldn't tell the difference, the grounds connected and were close enough that we didn't have any difficulty whatsoever finding each other. All of us were impressed with Iberostar, the, grounds, food, beach and the staff. Nothing to complain about at all, lots to recommend.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

likes.disliked: — The area outside of the resort

reviews.text: There was a good variety of food and we didn't have many problems making reservations at the sit down resturants. The Mexican speciality restaurant and Japanese were by far the best.
reviews.title: A good choice for a holiday

reviews.text: There was only one night where the steak house could not accomidate all of us at once, no big deal we split up and experienced two different restrauants that night.
reviews.title: Lovely, beautiful and so Friendly

likes.liked: — Huge beach, beautiful grounds, friendly people, & not too far from airport

reviews.text: The beach was perfect.... Beach bar close by, buffet and ice cream stand right there on the beach(loved the rum & raisin ice cream), and occasionally they cooked on the beach. It was a little piece of Paridise!
reviews.title: holiday of a life time

reviews.text: It was a very pleasant experience. Some details hold me back to give it an exellent rate but we are very happy in choosing this hotel for our vacation. There are plenty of food options and all are of very good quality. The lobby bar has many liquor options but bars closer to the pool and beach have limited options but no biggie. Activities for kids and adults get 5 stars since there is plenty of cool things to keep you and the young ones interested. Teenclub superb!!! As my kid had plenty of fun at night and me and my wife could enjoy in the bar and nightclub without any worries. The nightly shows are entertaining and awesome job with the "Rock Show". Our room had a slight humidity smell that it was a bit of a turndown, but then again you don't spend much time in the room anyways. The reservation options for the "gourmet" restaurants were a bit of a let down since everything was full and we had our two reservation dinners at 6:30pm and 7:00pm (too early for our preference).
reviews.title: Quite good overall!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service overall was great and 98% of staff where happy to attend to you and looked very happy doing it as well. I will only mention the sommelier at Pagoda as a bad experience. He never aproached our table yet he seemed happy to aproach all the other ones. Both my wife and I work in the wine buisness and since it was our last night we where looking forward a nicer wine option that what we had in all our trip, yet the sommelier never made it and I was not about to ask for him when he clearly ignored us.
reviews.title: Good 4 star not a 5 star

reviews.text: I would go back to this hotel and I recommend it to anyone. Beautiful beach, staff and property.
reviews.title: It was great vacation!

reviews.text: Let me start by saying we travel 2-3 times a year from all inclusive to cruising, generally I'm easily pleased, we stayed from August 29-September 3. Staff at the hotel were friendly and attentive, however there is a major communication problem if you do not speak French or Spanish. Even the waiters in the restaurants and bars had regular problems with English. Hotel was clean but slightly dated, pool area was excellent and the Bavaro beach no matter were you are is incredible. Rooms were both clean and tidy, bed was extremely comfortable. Evening entertainment was probably better than the norm however there is still the communication issue. Games around the pool and beech volleyball organized and were plentiful so there was plenty to do during the day. Plenty of beds around the beach and pool, just be up and out before 9 to get a palapa on the beach for covering. Breakfast was good as you would expect and lunches more than acceptable, food in the evening was a disappointment. Went to both the Steak House and the Sea Food a la cart and the food was OK. Service in the fish restaurant was bad. I would as I said class this hotel as a good 4 star and not the 5 that is published on some web sites. All in all i would consider going back at the right price, however they need to do something about the food.
reviews.title: Very unfriendly, male oriented service

reviews.text: I had really good time and great experience! The cleaning lady did a fantastic job in making sure my room was clean everyday. Food was good! The only thing that's missing was free WIFI, would be excellent if they had free wifi. Does not make sense for me to pay an hour internet service if what I wanted to do was just to check emails.
reviews.title: We're returning customers to this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Iberostar Dominicana for our first time visiting the Dominican. We went on 27/12/07 for two weeks. The flight over was horrible, we hadnt noticed that we had to stop in manchester 1st for 2hours to pick up more passengers, but after that the 9 hour flight was still veryyyy long, and it didnt help that the plane was filthy and the food was terrible!
reviews.title: Bloody Great Holiday!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But once arriving the heat hit us straight away, you start sweating almost immediately. The airport is a tiny little hut, where you get your photo taken and pay your entrance fee to the country. Once outside the airport, it only took 20 minutes to get to the hotel. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by one of the reception staff, given our all inclusive bands and a cold fruit drink. Once a few forms are signed, they gave us our key and off we went.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: We were room number 4249, it was a great room, right on the top floor facing the pool, sea, resturant and entertainment. The rooms were very nice, and really spacious. We had two double beds, fridge (which was stocked everyday), television, dressing table, two large wardrobes and a coffee maker and table. The bathroom is very modern and cleaned everyday. The is loadsss of nice food and plenty of it, we ate in 4 al a carte restaurants (mexican, steak house, star rock & oriental) we had no trouble booking any of these, just simply asked and got the times we wanted. In the day the food is great, they do show cooking outside and buffet style inside. We spent at least 9/14 days at the beach, its gorgeous, the sand is so soft and white. Im not much for the sea anyway, but I found it a little choppy as it is the atlantic ocean. The night entertainment is ok a little tacky compared to everything else there, it is all catered for familys with young kids, although there was a few good shows and new years eve was a good night, they gave out champagne, grapes and party packs. As for day trips we only did 1, and it was amazing we went to Saona island, it is such a great day out. you get to go on a catamaran, speed boat, visit a desterted island, have a bbq and at the end you go to a natural pool where you can hold star fish! I definately advise you do this trip, i think it cost £ 70 for the two of us. I would definitely go back to the Dominican and i would say back to this hotel but would try somewhere else just for a new experience. ONLY ONE BAD THING - DO NOT USE THE PHONE TO RING THE UK!!!! We had a bill for £140 for two weeks after making about 15 short calls. I think its something like £1.50 a minute!
reviews.title: Pure Paradise

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned yesterday from Punta Cana Dominican Republic, we enjoyed our stay at Iberostar Dominicana from Jan 26th thru Feb 2nd 2008. Our Apple Vacations Rep., Carlos did a great job.
reviews.title: The BestHotelIHaveEverStayedIn Xo !
Great Hotel let down by First Choice
reviews.text: We returned for the third time in March. We spent 3 weeks here in 2004, 2 weeks (at the Punta Cana) in 2007 and another 2 weeks this year. We love the hotel, the beach and, most of all, the staff. The food is great but not quite as outstanding as in 2004 but still OK for us as we go for the music, dancing, drinks, pool, beach etc.but - most of all - the friendly and welcoming staff. That's the positive side BUT:-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were ripped off by First Choice. We paid for extra leg room on the aircraft but were not allocated this on the Punta Cana - Manchester flight. Worse still, there was a clear scam being operated by the First Choice check-in staff who were charging passengers for having overweight baggage. We were certain ours was not overweight as we were within the limit when we left England and carried far less when we returned home. We have complained to First Choice who are completely dismissive. They do not answer the points raised but seem to be cutting and pasting from previous letters on similar (but not exactly the same) issues.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort, GREAT FOOD, Friendly Staff

likes.liked: — Excellent Food, Gardens, Beach bars, balcony views, comfortable and clean rooms

reviews.text: We would love to return for a fourth time but are concerned that First Choice has been "TUI-ed". John & Liz. Derbyshire UK.
reviews.title: We'd Go Back

reviews.text: The RESORT:
reviews.title: Standard Iberostar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week long stay at the Iberostar Dominicana. We had a TERRIFIC time! We have been to several other carribean countries before and we travel ALOT and this resort is VERY clean, excellent food and selection, staff is very courteous, the grounds are beautiful and very neat and clean with not a leaf out of place, with fish ponds around open air restaurants. and NO bugs of any kind. The rooms have a mini fridge bar that the maid keeps stocked for you, there are numerous housekeepers, and gardeners and grounds keepers that are constantly walking around cleaning, which was great to see. The weather was Sunny the entire time -- rained once or twice for just 15 minutes, then sun again... internet weather shows it cloudy all the time, but it is not at all. You can choose from several restaurants, serving any type of food you like - chinese, american, seafood, etc. There are activities going on around the pool all day, which makes for some funny entertainment. Entertainment at night was very entertaining --- they have an adult show and a separate kids show. It helps to know to little spanish, but not at all necessary. The beach was clean and great swimming. Other resorts North of this resort had LOTS of seaweed along the beach and in the water.
reviews.title: Perfection!!!!
Food poisoning at Iberostar Dominicana
reviews.text: We stayed at the Iberostar Dominicana for 2 weeks in March. We were travelling with a party of 9. 3 of the 9 got food poisining. the second day. My husband had it the worst and had to got to the hospital by ambulance and spend the night at the hospital. We heard of many people getting sick at the resort. The food was about a 2.5*. The rooms were clean and the people very friendly. I read alot of reviews before I left and was skeptical of the food and resort . Believe everything that you read of the food it was aweful. I would not recommend this resort at all.

We booked our trip through Apple Vacations--no other way to go! We arrived early around 10:30 am and our rooms were ready. Rooms very clean and towel formations were decorated with flowers every day. We never saw our maid but we left her a $2 tip every day and she made our stay a pleasant one--clean towels, washcloths, stocked cold drinks, turned down the beds at night with chocolates on our pillows and gave us fresh towels twice a day! A few dollars go a long way--so please tip! Beach and pool were beautiful and clean. We did learn after the 1st day that unless you got a Hammock by 8:00, you were out of luck. 4 chairs together were hard to find at beach and at pool. We started taking turns making a run to the beach by 8 to "reserve" chairs under a hammock like everyone else. Lots of bare boobies on the beach--most should've covered up--either too old, too saggy or entirely too fat to show it all!! Some even change their entire bathing suits (tops and bottoms, male and female) right in front of you with no hesitation. They're really quite experienced and you really only got a quick look of their private parts. Be aware that you'll get an eyeful! Specialty restaurants were very good. We ate at the Japanese/Chinese, Steakhouse, Gourmet Seafood--all were delicious! The main buffet was good also--much to choose from--but we're not picky eaters! We found that at lunch it was much better at the buffet on the beach where they have the steakhouse. Less variety but fresher and less of a crowd! You can actually sit on the beach with your feet in the sand, at a picnic table under a roof and enjoy a nice lunch! Really, the only thing that needs to improve are the shows. We seemed to only catch the "boring" ones. One night we went over to the Bavaro side and thought that their shows were better--then we realized that they rotate. Drinks were much better at the lobby bar. Pool and beach bars were o.k. but we never got a frozen drink. Drinks with dark rum were the best but be aware of the coconut milk - we learned that it's a natural laxative. 3 out of the 4 in our group had a short bout of diarrhea - bring imodium and/or pepto bismol. Staff were all very pleasant and had a good time with "Papa Johnson" at breakfast and "Juan" on the beach. We tested Juan everyday to see if he remembered our names--what a great guy! Overall, I would recommend the Iberostar Dominicana but prefer the Iberostar Tucan in Riviera Maya, Mexico. There's not much night life so plan on going to bed early--believe me you're ready! USA3000 at the Punta Cana airport needs major improvement--they were too slow checking in--lines were long and we waited well over an hour in the heat. Thank goodness we were returning home late at night when the sun's not beating down on the thatched roof with no air conditioning in this part of the airport. Security leaving was nonexistent--they didn't check anything--turned their heads away from the x-ray. I'll take the inconveniences of the security in the U.S. any day over the confusion and insecurity at the Punta Cana airport. Thank God we got on the right plane--mass confusion everywhere!! We'll maybe return someday but lots more islands and resorts to see before then!
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.text: THE DRINKS- The frozen drinks left alot to be desired. But, the beer was cold and we eventually found a couple of drinks they made well.

reviews.text: THE FOOD- We were told we had one trip to a specialty restaurant trip available. After eating the first night at the buffet, we showed up dressed decent to the speciality places and asked if we could eat there and were never turned down!! We ate at four specialty restaurants in five nights! Each were decent meals. The buffets were okay, nothing exceptional but nothing terrible either.
reviews.title: A memorable experience
Memorable trip to Iberostar Dominicana
reviews.text: We stayed at the IB Dominicana from oct.17-21/05. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the grounds are equally astounding. The pool was clean and well kept. The beach is one of the nicest we have been on. We felt the entire staff was eager and helpful. The room was large, clean and maid service was very good. We ate mostly at the buffets but did have reservatons at the steakhouse, its right on the beach so if you go be prepared to walk a few feet in soft sand. There are candles lit and you can hear the ocean, It was extremely romantic. It was my birthday and our anniversary so the staff sang to me as well. We thought the Mexican was allright, it says its airconditioned, but not too well. I really liked the Star Rock Cafe. I will admit I had a few "stomach issues", but my husband did not. We went to the Marinarium, and snorkeled with sharks and stingrays. We met a group from Canada, very funny people we hung out with. The water was warm and pretty clear. We also did the Outback Safari, you spend alot of time in the truck, but well worth it, we saw much of the island, made a supply donantion to the school(Pack books,crayons,art supplies, etc. ahead of time the effort will be greatly appreciated). There is lunch at a ranch, visits to a Dominican home and boogie boarding. We made friends with couples from several states and an English family, which really enhanced the experience. We liked the entertainment,even through the language barriers. I had a massage at the spa....very nice! Overall, We really enjoyed the hotel and have no real complaints about ambiance or service. This trip was also an excellent value.

reviews.title: Resort was beautiful
reviews.text: Our group stayed at the Iberostar Dominicana over Labor Day weekend. The place was beautiful. The rooms were very clean, the staff was friendly and the food was very good. I was very hesitant about staying here because our reservations for another hotel were cancelled two weeks before we left and we were then booked here. I should not have worried. I would go here again. The only negative thing I have to say about this resort was the 35 minute drive from the airport and the electrical outlets were not the standard U.S. outlets. If you have any kind of adapter for electrical equipment they will not fit in these outlets.

reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation despite the weather.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Iberostar Punta Cana October 10-14. Despite two days of heavy rain we still had a fantastic time.

reviews.title: the real deal you get there
reviews.text: The grounds are beautifully groomed and the rooms are very clean. Our maid kept out minibar stocked daily and also left towel swans on our bed and in the bathroom. We did leave a tip everyday, but I think we would have received the same service regardless.

reviews.title: Great holiday
reviews.text: The food at the resort was outstanding. We especially enjoyed the buffets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is beautiful and even though it is a bit older everything is impeccably maintained. We had a ground floor room which the maids kept spotless. And unlike other reviewers we didn't encounter any bugs. The mini bar was always stocked with water, pop and beer and every day we had a different towel animal and flowers throughout the room.
reviews.title: Fantastic trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is spectacular, soft sand, warm water and the palapas provide shade when you need it. You could find a palapa pretty much any time of the day - just a few rows back if you get to the beach later than 9.
reviews.title: Go there, you won’t be disappointed

reviews.text: The food at the resort is OK - pretty much what we were expecting. The Gourmet restaurant was good, seafood was mediocre but the Steak restaurant was actually really good. Definitely recommend that one. Our one complaint is that the drinks could have been better...or at the very least they could have one bar making drinks from scratch instead of just getting the slush from the machines. Definitely lacking in that area......We had one bartender that was making these delicious chocolate milk shakes one evening but when we asked the next night it wasn't even an option and they just told you to order from the drink menu. (Aka slush machine)

reviews.title: Excellent Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have traveled the world and found the DR to be our least favorite place. We stayed at the Dominicana which is a basic resort " not a 5 Apple" as suggested by Apple Vacations. The front desk staff was borderline rude and not helpful. We had problems with our phone and they basically told us that they would not fix it. The staff although friendly does not go above and beyond as was the case at other resorts and cruises we've visited in the past. I spent the 2nd day confined to my room with a stomach virus and a fever with the chills. We ate at the Mexican rest the night before. The food was terrible. We are from the US northeast and admittedly spoiled when it comes to food choices but in comparison to other vacations it was bad! Meats were over cooked and everything seemed to be slopped into a tray. Many times there were no cups or plates and we had to wait before we could eat. Couldn't wait to come home to eat. The room again was basic. The tub had chips in it and rust stains running down. The phone did not work correctly and the air cond either runs on 1 of 3 settings or is off, it does not turn on and off by itself. If you enjoy staying at the beach later then most be prepared to take a cold shower when you get back to your room. The maid kept leaving the sliding doors unlocked not sure if this was on purpose or not. Also be prepared to be harassed by locals to buy their products they are relentless. We took 4 excursions and they were all "different." The Outback safari was the only great professionally operated one. The ATV's were fun but mine only had rear breaks and another guy had a flat tire, the tires on all ATV's were nearly bald. Avoid the Saona island trip. The beach at the hotel was much better. Saona island beach was rocky and god forbid you want to relax on the beach, locals will actually wake you up to sell you things. And the massage women just come up to you and dump oil on you and start rubbing you wether you want it or not. BE AWARE OF THE "GYM." It's open air and equip is from 1960's and has the rust to prove it. It's above the spa and the worker at the gym lifted up the rubber mats to show us the holes in the wood floor underneath where weights had fallen through. The only saving grace was Bavaro Beach beautiful and fun. If choosing between Mexico and DR, hands down go to Mexico, Riviera Maya was great and Mexicans are much more accomidating! Good Luck!
reviews.title: Go to Mexico instead!

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was fine, good food and entertainment grounds kept in excellent condition - if only the rooms had the attention! We bought and paid for a 5* holiday for Christmas which cost £5500 for the family of 4, but were disappointed with the accomodation we have stayed in better 3* accomodation. Maybe we are hard to please as the other reviews all seem very positive. Beware although you are allowed to use the facilities at the adjacent Bavaro complex it is not included in the package therefore you may be able to sit at the pool bar but without a drink!

reviews.text: Check In:
reviews.title: Amazing New Year at Dominicana

reviews.text: We were not part of a large group, so check in took only minutes. We were not given a nice drink at check in, but we saw other groups who were :( If you want to use the safe in your room, it costs $2/day, and you need to tell the person at checkin so they can give you instructions. We were given a ride to our room on a cart and the bell boy brought our bags up to our room for us.
reviews.title: A Great Value For The Money
another great iberostar
reviews.text: Room:

We were dismayed for a minute to find that we had two double beds in our room, but we were too lazy to do anything about it, and it really wasn't a problem. The TV had pretty good channels. Since we were there during NFL playoffs and college bowl games, the hubby wanted to catch some of them and we were able to see some, but not all were broadcasted. The bathroom was clean, the water pressure and temperature were great. The AC unit was loud, but didn't really bother us. There is also a ceiling fan in the room, and without it the room did get very warm, even with the AC on. We were on the 4th floor, room 4323, so we had very high ceilings. There was a bench with a padded seat and throw pillows next to our bed, and it definitely smelled funky, so we didn't touch it the whole week!
reviews.title: Great AI Resort for families with older children

reviews.text: i just came back on march 10, 2007 with four of my friends from iberostar dominicana. it is my third time going to punta cana, and i always used apple vacations to book all my vacation but it will be my last, because:
reviews.title: i won't go back
Lot's of Fun, but needs a little improvement !!!

reviews.text: well as ths Iberostar Punta Cana but somehow they had our room at the Bavaro side that is better in my opinion.
reviews.title: great time

reviews.text: It was a great vacation with perfect weather.
reviews.title: Great place in Punta Cana

reviews.text: The Dominican people our the most friendly I have found in the Carribean. We have been to Punta Cana now 4 times so I do have some experience with this reveiw.
reviews.title: Great vacation, wonderful resort
11 DAYS OF PARADISE !!! (K & M Dickson - Wpg. Canada)
reviews.text: February 14th 2012 was the beginning of our Trip to Paradise (5th time in Punta Cana and 1st time at Iberostar Dominicana). Booked hotel separately with Sears Travel (Canada). They looked after all the all-inclusive details, including private driver (both from and return to airport), which was wonderful as there was no stopping at each resort along the way as there is with bus loads of hotel(s) guests. We had done the 'bus load' route before and was fun for the first few times (jolly fun with other folks), however, travel time to resort is cut drastically with own driver and cost is very reasonable.

reviews.title: Iberostar Dominican
reviews.text: Before beginning the review, as there have been so many negative reviews regarding the language barrier, I just want to touch on this so-called 'obstacle'. Just a reminder folks ... we are guests in a Spanish speaking country where, contrary to some folks ideas, English, is not the main language spoken!! In other words .... 'were are not in Kansas anymore Toto'. By simply purchasing a combination Spanish phrase book/dictionary and practicing a few key words/phrases, a vacation of perhaps frustration can become a very enjoyable experience.

reviews.title: our trip
reviews.text: We arrived at the resort mid-afternoon and check-in was a breeze. Each and every lobby staff member were very helpful, courteous, lots of fun, but still maintaining high level of professionalism. Our junior suite (which was absolutely spotless every day with fully stocked bar fridge - never any shortage of water, beer, soft drinks), boasted a gorgeous ocean front view. Once settled in, it is a good idea to book all the al-a-carte restaurant times for your length of stay. We also purchased (at check-in for the full 11 days) the internet hook-up. By the time we reached our suite it was hooked up. We did have a lot of luggage, which was thankfully taken to our suite via motorized cart (what a great way to take in a quick overview of the gorgeously maintained grounds) as the resort is very large.

reviews.title: Punta Cana Vacation
reviews.text: THE BEACH: One word .. GORGEOUS .. There are more than enough palapas, chairs, and even quite a few small drink/book tables. We managed to get a perfect spot each morning (yes ... after breakfast around 10 am). One thing we did find (sadly) amusing: there were yellow signs under many of the palapa roofs stating 'absolutely no saving of palapas' ... during our first week, probably 95% of the guests adhered to that, but sadly towards the end of our stay a very large percentage simply ignored the 'do not' sign. There is absolutely NO need to 'reserve before going for breakfast', as there never appeared to be a shortage; plus there is no 'bad view' of the beach/ocean.

reviews.title: incredible stay
reviews.text: THE POOL(S): We were only at the pool twice during our stay (coming from snow, wanted to be close to as much sand/ocean as possible); and thoroughly enjoyed the relaxation & water. No swim up bar but really not necessary - we either took a walk to get drinkos, and/or servers brought them to us.

reviews.title: ROACHES !!
reviews.text: My wife and I spent few days of July 2013 in this resort. First impression very positive: clean, nice swimming pool, friendly staff in breakfast bar, wide offer of tasty food. In middle of our time we found under door in five languages note: “We kindly inform you that tomorrow, between 10.00 and 2.00hr, your room will be fumigated…not of any danger to your health…”, so better than with roaches. In last evening I walked into our bathroom and on front wall was slowly walking down nice ROACH! We called front desk; after 30 minutes came room lady with spray. She sprayed everywhere and informed us: this is not dangerous for human, just only lemon scent. Whole next day, in travel home, both of us we had headache. I expect from this class, as is informing Apple Vacation on web page: no ROACHES to share room with them, and better communication with resort staff, they tried speak other than Spanish language especially in a la carte restaurants. Also, my bad luck, I met many rude gusts with heavy Russian accent.

reviews.title: Great stay-just what I needed
reviews.text: NO MORE IN IBEROSTAR RESORTS.

reviews.title: Don't hesitate to book this hotel
reviews.text: In July I did my first solo trip for my birthday (it won't be the last) and it was my first time in the DR.

reviews.title: Very NICE family vacation
reviews.text: The resort staff were great, the hotel was in good condition, food was fresh and had variety, lots of great sports to choose from including a good gym (for those of us who like to work out or do beach sports like volleyball or soccer etc definitely a thumbs up).

reviews.title: Excellent staff!
reviews.text: I didn't think travelling alone, especially on my birthday would be so great! All of the staff ensured I was well attended to. Special thanks to Eusebio at the front desk who ensured I had great service every time. Ramon R (there are 2 Ramon's) in the Dominicana Buffet restaurant for remembering what I like to drink at every meal and finding me a table for one (which was often difficult to do with all the families there). I had one of the best massages ever from Fatima at the spa!

reviews.title: Loved it! :)
reviews.text: We just returned from our trip. There's not one thing bad that I can say about this resort! The people were great, facilities were wonderful, and the food was way better than I thought it would be. I have an eight year old son who had a blast! Be sure to wake up extra early to get a cabana either by the pool or on the beach. Other than that have a wonderful trip. We will be returning to this resort!

reviews.title: Family of four loved it!!!!!
reviews.text: We just got back from our stay at the Dominicana and had a great time. I had read all the reviews so I was a bit worried. The hotel is beautiful. The staff was outstanding. The food was above average, something for everyone. The entertainment staff was always getting everyone involved. The pm Broadway show was a little cheesy and very hot!!!! I brought down some small water bottles in my suitcase and was very glad I did. I was afraid to drink the water but only the tap water was bad. The rooms were nice. We were able to upgrade so our kids got their own space with a TV. Definitely hold onto your towels and claim your beach or pool chairs early. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and will go back.

reviews.title: Loved the Dominicana
reviews.text: We travelled to the Dominican Republic from the 27th June to 11th July. We found the dominicana a fantastic place to stay the food was excellent and so were the staff especially the waitress Martine. The staff all worked so hard cleaning the rooms every day and restocking the mini bar. The reps were also fantastic providing us with fantastic entertainment day and night, especially Jack and Mac.

reviews.title: Amazing wedding and holiday!
reviews.text: Whilst staying at the dominicana we got married on the beach which was well organised by the wedding team and went smoothly we had a fantastic day.

reviews.title: Loved it Loved it Loved it
reviews.text: The grounds and the pool area were also well kept

Travelled on Nov. 30th- Dec. 6th with 2 other couples and have several items to discuss. First was the issue of the construction going on in the area. We were told that it was almost completed but this was a out and out lie. When we left in Dec. it was still going on. The biggest issue we had was the amount of salt that was applied to all of the meals even including the alacart restaurants. Could not believe how much we all bloated up due to this. WATCH OUT FOR THE SALT IN THE FOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.Our rooms were 2 doors away from the construction area and when we asked to be moved we were told sorry the hotel is booked solid so we were stuck there and we were assured that they would stop at 5 PM. Noise started at 7 AM and went on till at least to 9 Pm. This was the worst of our stay .
reviews.title: Watch out for the salt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very good. Pool was okay and entertainment staff was excellent. Beach was very busy due to the amount of people walking from all of the resorts in the area.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first time to DR-beach is probably the most beautiful we have seen! Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Resort was very clean and comfortable, easy to get around. All the food was very, very good, including the buffets. Entertainment was very good as well. Grounds were beautifully landscaped & manicured. Pool area was great, although we mostly used the amazing beach. We will love to come back to DR and Iberostar!
reviews.title: amazing vacation

reviews.text: Iberostar Dominicana was an amazing resort. I did my research on trip advisor and it really helped. This place is so great and much better than some of the other resorts in the area! Our flight was cancelled leaving DR and we were put up at a different resort that was horrid. That resort was so awful and it just showed how great the Iberostar was in comparison. Iberostar has awesome and friendly staff. They also have nightly entertainment that my fiance and I STILL talk about... the staff who did the entertainment shows were SO fun and wonderful (shout out to Junior). Food was great. We ate at the restaurants too and that was great. The beach, chairs, beds, all in all I have zero complaints.
reviews.title: A delightful time!

reviews.text: I was at the Dominicana from 2/18 to 2/25 with my DH, 5 yr old daughter and another couple. We are seasoned travelers with one prior visit to Punta Cana and numerous stays at a variety of AI's (most often in Riviera Maya). Overall, we had a very nice time at the Dominicana with no real problems.
reviews.title: Family vacation
Just Returned from the Punta Cana 8/29
reviews.text: My husband, mysef and my two girls, 4 and 7 just returned from the Iberostar Punta Cana. Overall it was an excellent trip. We had stayed at the Iberostar Paraiso Del Mar last year in the Riveria Maya, (which was awesome) so we had very high expectations.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Beautiful Beach...A relaxing 2 weeks!
reviews.text: We flew through apple vacations on the USA 3000 airline, it was a great flight...on time both ways (actually we arrived almost 1 hr early on the return flight). This airline still serves meals and has a complimentary movie too. Check in was easy with them...no problems at the airport in Punta Cana. Like some other people wrote....watch out for the aggressive baggage handlers if you don't want any help! Our transfers were included and it was easy to get from the plane to the charter bus. The hotel is a short 30 minute ride in an air-conditioned bus.

reviews.title: Iberostar Punta Cana - Beautiful, family-friendly resort
reviews.text: The Iberostar Punta Cana/ Domincana grounds are beautiful! very similar to the Riveria Maya resort. Lots of ponds with fish, turtles, flamingo's etc.. They work very hard to keep the grounds very clean. This resort is very large so I would not recommend it for anyone who does not enjoy long walks! I took the advice I read on this site and offered $30 at check-in and asked for an upgrade with a beach view. They were very nice and told me if I waited a short while they would have a nice room ready for us. We were very impressed, they put us on the highest floor with a beachfront view. Very nice! I had read some rooms were musty and older, but this room was very fresh and clean. They have small fridges in each room, with bottled water that is replenished daily by the maid. Keep in mind they are just "coolers", so the drinks are not ice cold, but they do the trick. They also provide a gallon of water in each room too, which is fine to drink. The water/ice served in the rest's, bars is fine. Just don't drink out of the tap. Also the air-conditioning in our room worked great...the setting is on the headboard of the bed...it took me a while to find it.

reviews.title: Iberostar Punta Cana and Dominicana
reviews.text: Beach here is better than I have seen anywhere! The softest, white sand. No shells, rocks, coral......nothing! The Iberostar is one of the only hotels with a large number of shade cabana's on the beach and all around the pool. You do need to reserve early (9 am) but I've found that at most hotels. Keep in mind there are a lot of guests here. There are two pools right next to each other. The Domincana pool has most of the activity..its a lot of fun, but it does get loud..so if you are looking for a little quiet, try to find a spot at the Punta Cana pool away from the action. I was a little dissapointed there was no swim-up bar and no pool waiters. The bars were a little far away...I wished they were closer. Pools were great for kids....zero-depth entry. We did walk down to the Bavaro (next door) and swim in that pool. It was nice too. A little quieter, with a swim-up bar. You are not sopposed the be able to get drinks from the bar there, but we didn't have any problems.

reviews.title: FANTASTIC TWO WEEKS
reviews.text: Food was good. The buffet's had huge selections, but a lot of it included really different things we are not used to eating. There were guests from all over the world here...American's were definately the minority. Not bad, just different. When you go to a different country, you can't expect the pizza to taste like pizza hut or the steak like Outback or Lone Star! Breakfasts were good...lots of american choices, eggs/ omlets cooked to order, bacon, pancakes, french toast, hashbrowns...

Myself and my husband travelled to the iberostar dominicana in june 2006, upon arrival we were greeted with a drink and shown to our room. The room itself was clean, we had no bugs or insects as I had previously read on trip advisor from other reviews. We found the whole hotel, from the beach to the lobby to be spotless, the grounds were constantly being maintained and loooked lovely.
reviews.title: nice time at iberostar dominicana

reviews.text: The staff were all really helpful and friendly, always had a smile and a hello, despite the fact they all worked really hard and long hours.
reviews.title: Wonderful Holiday

reviews.text: The food in the buffet did tend to be the same each day and there was not a lot of choice, both of us had upset stomachs whilst there, but couldnt say it was definately from the food, although I was concerned that some items i.e cooked meats and cheese appeared to be left out unchilled in the buffet areas for long periods. On a more positive note, we found the food in the oriental, steakhouse and star rock cafe to be lovely - we booked these were possible to avoid the buffet!!
reviews.title: Great Holiday, Great Hotel

reviews.text: The entertainment was good, the staff worked really hard to keep the guests entertained, both by the pool and on an evening, although there is plenty of quiet places if you just want to chill out and have a drink. We enjoyed the star rock cafe and the nightclub, and had a few dabbles at the casino.
reviews.title: Loved the Iberostar Domincan
Lovely resort, but I became sick and was hospitalized.
reviews.text: We took a couple of trips out of the hotel, the best of which was the outback safari, would definately recommend this, we had a really good time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at the Iberostar Dominicana from January 26th - February 2nd. We had a great time and we were very impressed with the resort. We chose it based upon the rating it had on Trip Advisor at the time (#8) but after reading some reviews we weren't sure what to expect. This review is based upon OUR experience but written in response to some of the other reviews I have seen. I've also included some tips that we didn't do or forgot to do but felt were definitely good to know regardless.
reviews.title: Our first Iberostar Experience!

likes.disliked: — Nothing! We honestly had no issues...

reviews.text: ROOM: The rooms are very nice! We ended up with two beds so definitely try and ask before they bring you to your room. That would have been the only complaint. Every room has a balcony which is nice. We were on the ground floor and they did a great job with the landscaping to the point that it would take a lot of work to even get to our balcony, let alone try and get in. The mini-bar was stocked with pop, water, and beer. We tipped our maid $2 US every day with a basic note like: "Su propina" so she would know to take the money. Doing that, it kept our mini-bar stocked every day; they claim it will only be filled every other day. The bathroom was nice and in good shape along with the rest of the room amenities. As for the plugs, they will work for US plugs but depending on your plug you may need the adapter because the plugs are recessed. For instance, my cell phone charger plug was too wide that it didn't reach the outlet due to the cover being a good inch off of the wall. I highly suggest you wait and see if you have any problems and if you do need an adapter they sell them at the store in the lobby for 65 cents. For sure buy the cheap one because that is all you need. If the plug doesn’t fit immediately just keep wiggling it because the adapter is cheap and is more of an extension than an adapter. The only complaint we had was that we came back with some phantom funk on our used clothes and suitcases that had to have come from the room. We didn't smell it when we were there but when we opened up our suitcases when we got home it was obvious. That being said, not much you can do and we certainly don't blame the resort.
reviews.title: Nice place for the budget price

reviews.text: BEACH: Yes, take along a thermos mug. We forgot but had planned on it. It is not imperative that you have one because the drinks are decent sized but it still would have been nice to have one on the beach. We definitely witnessed that the bartenders are more than happy to rinse it out and fill it up with your favorite beverage. As for getting up early to get yourself a chair, we didn't have that problem for the chairs. If you do really want a covered spot, you have to get out there fairly early but certainly not at 6:30 AM like some posts I've read. Perhaps during busier times it would matter but they claimed our hotel was at capacity so who knows. Also, the Dominicana has a great spot on the beach because it is by everything so that could have something to do with it. It was beautiful sand and the water was great. Absolutely no complaints on the beach!
reviews.title: Disappointing for Iberostar Fans
It was ok
reviews.text: STAR FRIENDS & STAFF: The employee's were always more than willing to assist you. Most of them spoke and/or understood English better than I speak or understand Spanish. The Star Friends work ALL day and are very friendly. I have read posts saying that the entertainment was European based but I disagree. It is simply resort based and they are doing their best to make sure you are having fun, if you want to. I was very partial to volleyball and they had games going almost all day. They also had goofy games and things and if you are interested go for it... they are fun! If not, you can just laugh at the people who are doing it. All in all the staff is there to make sure you have a great time and they certainly succeeded in our case. The night events are okay and we generally watched them after dinner which is the "adult show" but really is just different "variety hour" type performances with a heavy emphasis on audience participation. Either way, if you don't like it there are other things to do...

reviews.title: Unique
reviews.text: CASINO: They had a small casino with Blackjack, Slots, Roulette and a few other games. I was disappointed they didn't have my game of choice, craps, but I did end up winning some decent money at Blackjack so I didn't mind too much! I have seen other posts that claim you need to watch the dealers like a hawk to make sure they aren't cheating. Now maybe that was how it used to be but when I was there they had an extra employee at each table (kind of a middle management pit boss) making sure that everything was legit. A couple times the dealer had to check with them on something and they were always correct. I had no problems just concentrating on betting and not having to make sure the dealer was on the "up and up." Again, if you are into it you will have a good time...

We traveled together with another family -four adults, two teens and a six year old. We booked through Apple Vacations at the beginning of January. Because the week we wanted was April/Easter break, most of the resorts were already filled. Dominicana was not our first choice, but it turned out to be a great place to stay. This was our fourth Dominican vacation.
reviews.title: Overall a Good Choice

reviews.text: The 45 minutes to the resort seemed like a really long ride, but check in was easier than most. You are given an envelope with wrist bands, towel cards, keys and info, then sent to a table for "orientation". We skipped this part and went directly to our room. Keep in mind that room assignments are made prior to your arrival. The front desk clerks do not have the authority to change your room at check in. If you want to change rooms, speak to the manager and most likely you will get a new room assignment the following day.
reviews.title: great beach, pool, hotel, people--but queasy stomachs hit 5 out of 8
Iberostar Dominicanan-GREAT! April 2006
reviews.text: Room: Ours was on the pool side #4263. I believe that 4 stands for the building, 2 stands for third floor and 63 is the actual room number. Although it is a 4 story building, when you get into the elevator you can see that ground floor is "zero" so go figure! The higher the room number, the closer you will be to the beach. Odd numbers are poolside, even numbered rooms look onto the Bavaro bungalows and Caribbean Street. The buildings themselves, Dominicana and Punta Cana are nearly identical and face each other. The landscaping at these resorts is well above average. There are maze like pathways and gardens between the two buildings that lead to the pools and lobby.

The most striking thing was the interior space within the building itself. The rooms are all situated around a fabulous inner atrium with fountains, lush palm trees, reflecting water gardens and hanging plants. The sound of the running water within this space eliminated the usual hallway noises , voices and door banging.
reviews.title: Had a fabulous time!!!

reviews.text: The room itself was somewhat of a disappointment. Although it was quite large, with a very private balcony and great partial ocean/pool view, the paint and fabrics were in sad shape. Not terrible, but not great. The bathroom was nice, smallish tub, large mirror, hair dryer, stone tile. Housekeepers did an excellent job. Towel sculptures and fresh flowers are provided each day. (No coffee makers or umbrellas in rooms). A covered tile walkway on the Bavaro side of the building allowed you to walk all the way to the lobby and restaraunts, very nice if it rains. We also saw several people in wheel chairs, so it appeared to be fairly handicapped accessible. There were no actual oceanfront rooms that we could see, and the way the main building was layed out , no one was at a real disadvantage location wise except for the suites. They were the farthest from beach and pool, and did not look much different from the standard rooms, perhaps fresher paint.
reviews.title: had a blast at the Iberostar Dominicana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival at the Iberostar Dominicana, there was "no record" of our reservation for which I had a confirmation letter and number in hand from Funjet Vacations. The local Funjet representative was contacted by telephone, who maintained that we had a reservation, but the Iberostar denounced it, nor had any rooms available at any of its three complexes that night. We waited for hours while the Iberostar reception searched for another hotel to put us up in for the night. Finally, we got a room at a hotel ranked 2.0 by Funjet versus 4.0 for the Iberostar Dominicana. We checked into the downgraded hotel at 12 am, missing dinner and entertainment.
reviews.title: Terrible customer service

reviews.text: Meanwhile, we incurred $40 in taxi and inconvenience fees shuttling in between hotels. We also had to put $200 on our credit card for the new hotel room. This money was refunded to us in cash the next day when the Iberostar Dominicana miraculously found our reservation and sent a van to pick us up at 12 noon. Nonetheless, we had already paid $270 for the Iberostar room, plus incurred $40 in extra charges due to the one night displacement. We lost a total of $110 due to the Iberostar Dominicana's mistake. In addition, we lost eight hours of time enjoying our vacation.
reviews.title: Ideal beach vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Iberostar upgraded our room for the next two nights and called it "even." However, we immediately stated that we did not want the upgrade, rather, compensation for one night's stay. The reception desk indicated that the upgraded room was the only one available, so we would be staying there regardless of any credit. We were then referred to the general manager, who said that the hotel would not refund any of our money.
reviews.title: Planning to go back

reviews.text: The lack of customer service we experienced at the Iberostar Dominicana negated the high quality of the resort. There are several other five-star resorts in the area where vacationers will likely be treated better and guaranteed to have a room upon arrival.
reviews.title: Hope you like the Buffet!
Wow!
reviews.text: I just returned from a 10 night stay at the Dominicana. As others have stated, the grounds, pools and beach are beautiful. I rated our trip as above average - why not exceptionall? The food. I am not a picky eater and neither is my family - we had a difficult time finding something to eat at the buffets. Yes, you could always find something & we did...the food here was not comparable to other Iberostars I've stayed at. We never had any issues with getting sick. We did use the bottled water to brush our teeth etc, but had no problems with the water in the dining rooms or ice in the drinks.

I stayed at the Iberostar Dominicana Hotel in October 2011 for 6 nights. It was my 3rd time to this resort. I was with a group of 7 friends and had a great time. The best part of this hotel is the beach. You can walk forever and it is a beautiful beach. Plenty of palapas while we were there. No need to get up at 7am to reserve your loungers and palapas for the day. It was a slower time so maybe that was part of the reason. In my opinion the beach is the best part of this hotel. It is great!! While we were there in October, they were renovating the beach bar and snack bar so it was closed. It was a disappointment and I wish I would've known that before I booked. But, hey, it wasn't that big of a deal. They put a bar further down the beach and just had to walk a little farther to get lunch or a snack. It was all right. They opened the new bar and snack bar the day after we left, but we got a peek at it and it looked really nice. The food is good, not amazing, but good. The buffet always was stocked and something different most days. The staff is outstanding too. The Star Friends team is great at getting people involved in activities if you want. The staff all around is great. I have been to this resort three times and have never been in the pool. It looks really nice, but I'm a beach person. I would recommend this resort!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Spent 2 glorious weeks at the Iberostar Dominicana. First time in the DR but not my last. Everything about the resort was terrific. Our room was perfectly situated, we were close to everything - the beach, the pool, stores, restaurants. The beach is magnificent and we had the choice of 2 pools. The people at the resort were wonderful, they seemed genuinely happy to do whatever they could for us. Service at the restaurants was wonderful and the food at the buffet was terrific. They changed themes on a nightly basis which made for a pleasant variety.
reviews.title: Great vacation

reviews.text: We took advantage of reserving the specialty restaurants and have to say that the mexican restaurant was absolutely fabulous. We ate there twice and would have been happy to have done it a couple of more times. The staff was exceptional.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone working at the resort went out of their way to make our stay happy.
reviews.title: Iberostar Dominicana, it's about people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a travel agent from Toronto, Canada, I was at the Iberostar Dominicana on February 17,2012 for 2 wks with a group of 50 pax,
reviews.title: Let's go again...

reviews.text: Just returned from the Dominica Republic where we stayed at the Iberostar Dominicana Hotel in Punta Cana. Overall, it was great. The 2 things that impressed us the most: 1) very, very clean, and 2) the staff was friendly and took a lot of pride in what they do.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach

reviews.text: The beach was absolutely beautiful.... you can walk literally for miles in either direction. There was always a breeze coming in from the Atlantic, so it was comfortable but not too hot on the beach. Plenty of loungers for sunning. And clean - I have traveled extensively throughout the Caribbean and this was definitely one of the the cleanest places I have stayed. The shower in the hotel room was great - plenty of water pressure, plenty of hot water, although my friend didn't have any water to shower on our last day.... strange, because I had just showered without a problem.
reviews.title: paradise, absolute paradise

likes.liked: — the staff, the food, the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and drinks were mediocre. Not a lot of seafood overall, which was surprising given the location. Most of the meat was overcooked. One very yummy dish was the calamari served at the restaurant close to the water. You are suppose to have reservations, but we were seated twice without them.... there were only 2 in our party, and I did see larger parties being turned away. Recommend that you make reservations for the theme restaurants when you first arrive.
reviews.title: Can I go back yet!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately I got traveler's diarrhea, but my friend did not. I did narrow it down to the water, even though it is filtered. Met a few other travelers who stayed at different resorts who had the same problem. This is the first time I have gone to the Caribbean without taking antibiotics along for "just in case", but thankfully I was able to buy some over the counter at the hotel pharmacy. But definitely take your own antidiarrheal agent just in case - the cost for 10 capsules of Immodium at the pharmacy was $30 US!
reviews.title: Excellent holiday!
Awesome
reviews.text: Lastly, the dive shop (Dressel Divers) at the resort was very professional, although pricey ($65 per dive if you pay in cash, $72 for credit). But the dive masters were very good! If you love to dive, take one of the excursions across to the Caribbean side - well worth it, as the diving on the Atlantic side was poor. I did 2 excursions, and both days Andre was the dive master. He was really very good, provided very safe dives. My friend usually runs out of air before I do, and Andre took her up to the surface and buddied me up with another diver so that I could dive longer.

we had two weeks in the hotel dominicana, at punta cana, dom rep. for my daughter's wedding, in april last year. there was twenty of us went out there for the wedding. it was fantastic, the food was top notch, everything from t.bone steak to lobster, was all part of the all inclusive package. the drinks were also class, mostly imported top class named brands. there is eight restuarants all serving top class food, everthing from japanese to mexican.even the animation team were brilliant, working from early morning, to late at night, to make our holiday more enjoyable. we travelled with thomas cook from manchester.if anyone out there is going to the hotel dominicana, i have no doubt whatsoever you will have a fantastic time. we will be going back very shortly.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel Dominicana, Punta Cana. Dominican Republic.

likes.disliked: — there was nothing i disliked about the whole holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hello my wife and I just returned on April 6th from a week of the most relaxing period of time I think I have ever had. We booked with Apple vacations and stayed at the Iberostar Punta Cana. We flew out of St.Louis on a direct charter.
reviews.title: WOW what a relaxing place to stay

likes.liked: — Beach, everything very clean, the staff
likes.disliked: — A few of the Europeans can be a little rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything went extremely smooth, due in fact that there is a Apple rep. available ever step of the way. The flight went smooth, and when you land in Punta Cana you well be escorted into a open air building where you will pay $10 to enter the country and they will give you a slip of paper that you will carry about 20feet to another person that will ask for it back? Why I don't know but thats what they do. Then you will get your luggage and as soon as you turn a corner with it you will be swarmed by young fellas wanting to carry your bags for you. We let them for they know exactly where to go and will get you to your waiting bus alot faster, and all they want is a couple dollar tip.
reviews.title: Good time for our 1st all-inclusive

likes.disliked: — Things to do outside the resort - pollution and trash in the DR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bus ride is not all that bad, yes its a little rough, and yes there is some garbage along the streets, but we found it very interesting, and only about 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Great advise for someone going there!

likes.liked: — Very clean and attention to detail
likes.disliked: — some bug bites and moldy odor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is extremly beautiful, we stayed on the Punta Cana side which we liked because it was less crowded and less noise. The room at first was a little musky but open up the patio door and its fine. Also its very clean, and a couple dollars to the cleaning lady does go a long way in getting more towels and bottled water.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Hotel

likes.liked: — Beach and overrall layout of hotel

reviews.title: Way overrated
reviews.text: Just returned from a trip to Punta Cana. We stayed at the Iberostar Dominicana. I am not the typical spoiled individual who expects the red carpet treatment everywhere I go nor is this my first trip outside of the United States. I have traveled extensively throughout the world and can honestly say this was one of the worst places I ever stayed.

The food was horrendous. There were bugs (including roaches) in the room and tiny ants in the bathroom. The maid service was good, I will say and the room (at least on the surface) was cleaned well daily.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel! Can't beat Iberostar when it comes to service and entertainment

reviews.text: Cheese at the buffet was left uncovered without ice for hours.
reviews.title: Do as little or as much as you want
OK but was not great
reviews.text: The pool is only open until 7pm forcing people to have no other choice but either sit in their room and watch CNN or attend trashy shows in the main lobby. These shows were ridiculous and I am still trying to figure out why they even bothered putting them on. There was absolutely no variety.

reviews.title: Hooray, we have found perfection!
reviews.text: Towards the end of the trip, I got extremely sick with some kind of stomach bug I am sure was from unclean food prep. When calling the 24-hour clinic on staff there the response was that "many people who come here get sick." If that's the case, wouldn't one think it's time for some evaluation?

USA 3000 seats very hard and some misinformation about travel cards Side trips - Saona Island and Outback Safari were incredible and worth the money - Dominican people wonderful proud of their island and very friendly - Casino slots looser than I expected - won $$$ Expect nudity by people who really should'nt! This will be one of my favorite vacation destinations
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation at Iberostar Dominicana

reviews.text: because of the lush island location and beach but the resort is really not up to IB standards and rooms are definitely not 5 star
reviews.title: Would never go back

likes.liked: — The rooms were nice and air conditioned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I just returned from the Iberostar Dominicana. Although she has been Punta Cana many times, it was my first trip there and I wasn’t sure what to expect.
reviews.title: Great Time
3 star rating
reviews.text: HOTEL – First and foremost I would say CLEAN, the rooms were very clean and the public areas were also kept clean. There seem to always be someone mopping the marble floors and there was never any trash sitting around. The rooms are very spacious with a semi-private balcony. The courtyards were well maintained with lots of different varieties of plants trees and fountains. The center courtyard was awesome with nice stoned walkways that were well lite at night. The walkways are lined with shrubbery that looks like they trim everyday. Now if you are expecting the Ritz Carlton, this isn’t your place. However you can’t get much better for the money and lets face it, how much time are you expecting to be spending in the room?

POOL – Again, it was very well maintained and clean. They have ample chairs with cushions and plenty of huts for those who what to stay out of the sun. The only down side to the pool is that they don’t have a swim up to bar. Although there are a few bars located very close to the pool area.
reviews.title: Great Fun at Iberostar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BEACH – WOW is all that I can say. Again very clean, there were people walking around all the time picking up any trash or glass that were sitting around. Again there was an ample amount of chairs and huts. Although it was a little windy when we were there I would guess and say that the water was about 82 degrees if not warmer. This beach is a top optional beach. I’d say that not more than 5% of the women were topless and when they were, it was tastefully done and there wasn’t a lot of gawking.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

likes.disliked: — Some of the food and not a lot of evening activity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD – The buffets offer a wide variety of different foods, I’m a picky eater and we had our concerns that I might not find enough food that I like. It turned out not to be a problem. The food wasn’t the best tasting food I’ve ever eaten but it was good enough.
reviews.title: Had a fun time!!
We had a lovely time - Very relaxing
reviews.text: As a family of two teenagers and two adults we visited this hotel in July 06. Reading some of the reviews before hand we were a little nervous. We had a lovely relaxing holiday. You could do as much or as little as you wanted with no hassles. The food was nice with lots of choice. We visited all the speciality restaurants but our favourite was the mexican and the chinese. It was one of our daughters birthday while we were there and we had a cake made and presented to her in the chinese restaurant along with a bottle of champagne (they did add we could have more champagne if we wanted) and the dominicans famous birthday chant. The staff were excellent and very friendly.. Entertainment was ok, but if you preferred something different take a walk over to their sister hotels next door. Beach lovely, pool nice as only went once, preferred the beach. Pina Colada with rum was fantastic. Worth going back for the hotel, beach and the Pina Colada. Great stuff!! Give it a try!!

reviews.title: Very Nice Resort
reviews.text: We just returned from a wonderful week at the Iberostar Dominicana. After reading all of these reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect- I was pleasantly surprised that most of what people complained about seemed to be exagerated.

reviews.title: Awesome vacation resort!!!
reviews.text: Food- I could always find something to eat. If you are there for a week, the breakfast and lunch selections are repetitive, so try to not eat everything you see in the first few days. We made reservations for 2 nights. The Gourmet was the best. It was a 5 course meal with grilled lobster and amazing asparagus soup. The tropical restaraunt- The Marimba was also very good. We also went to the Rock Star Cafe two nights. The food is great and you don't have to make reservations. It is very small though, so I would recommend going right at 7.

Room- Our room was fine. There was a slight musty smell, but there always is when you are in the tropics. The worst part of the room were the pillows. They were so flat, I am not sure why they even put them on the bed. Another thing to warn you about is the water in the bathroom- it smells. We had an old shower curtain that smelled horrible and had to ask the maid to bring another one.
reviews.title: Our good experience

reviews.text: Pool and Beach- I was amazed at how many people laid on the beach. I have been traveling to Mexico for the last few years and everyone spends time at the pool- that is not the case here. We had an early riser in our group who saved chairs by the pool, but we wouldn't have had a problem getting chairs if we had slept in. The pool was very nice and was always being cleaned. The beach was very crowded with walkers from the other resorts. Lots of topless women that you probably would have rather not seen topless!
reviews.title: Resort Beautiful-Country Beware!!!

likes.liked: — Had A Blast With Our Friends
likes.disliked: — Having Money Stolen At The Airport

reviews.text: Beautiful beach + friendly staff = good vacations.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach + friendly staff = good vacations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a family vacation at the Iberostar Dominicana, Punta Cana, Dominican Republic.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel best beach in Punta Cana

reviews.text: The hotel is a large beach resort with no air conditioning on the lobby or halls. The hotel is beautiful and is in generally good conditions. Lots of gardens, nicely manicured and clean. There are two hotels side by side the Iberostar Dominicana and the Iberostar Punta Cana.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort lots of fun

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and were generally clean. There are few construction finishing details (like caulking splashed around the bathroom mirror) that were not what you anticipate from a 4 star hotel. Beds are not very good, we both had back pain couple of times (which we quickly forgot with piña coladas) however recommend the hotel management to consider replacing the beds for better quality mattresses and pillows.
reviews.title: Started rough, ended fantastic!

reviews.text: We did saw couple of cockroaches but that is very common in Caribbean countries, no big deal!
reviews.title: Great time with great people!
Wonderful resort. Again, no complaints!
reviews.text: It's the third time, we've been to the Iberostar in Punta Cana. Now, we've stayed at all three resorts, Bavaro, Punta Cana and Dominicana. It's probably not the last time because, like all stays, it's been perfect!

reviews.title: Wish I Hadn't Left the Hotel--The Longest Review Ever...
reviews.text: The rooms are perfectly clean and if there's a small problem they'll fix it right away. For example, we didn't figure out the safe and the balcony-door lock didn't work. Both times, they sent sosmeone over who had the problem fixed whithin a few minutes. Also the reception-desk called right away to check if all was done well.
The pool is clean and large. Watch out for the slippery sides though!
reviews.title: Needs renovation

reviews.text: The food is so good. No stomach-problems whatsoever. A lot of choice at the buffets. The plates are constantly refreshed, when there's just a third (of the item) left.
reviews.title: Would Return in a Minute!!

reviews.text: Can't say anything about the restaurants, because we didn't go there.
reviews.title: for a little getaway...perfect
Had a great time
reviews.text: I just got back from the Iberostar Dominicana and all I can say is that we had a great time there. The beach is gorgeous, the hotel and the rooms were very beautiful and clean and there is a big garden with a lot of palm trees.

reviews.title: You should definitely read this before going!!!!
reviews.text: The animation team was FANTASTIC, I liked the merengue parties at the pool and with all the smiling faces and the dancing people there you immediately forget all the stress from home.

reviews.title: would recommend but wouldn't go back
reviews.text: We met a lot of other people. Most of the tourists there indeed are Europeans (seems Americans don't like us?? read it in the post above...). We met a lot of other people from Belgium and Holland and we had a great time.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: Btw - to give a reaction to the post above - it 's true that there are quite a lot women sunbathing topless. But why should it only be Europeans ??? Isn't it everywhere where the weather is sunny that some women don't want to have straps? If you are shocked by some nude ----- you better go to Tunisia of Maroc or some other islam country there it's forbidden :) I admit that sometimes the sight of a 50 year old woman sunbathing topless isn't very pretty but we just laughed with it. I can't imagine how the travel agent could warn you for that... He can't know that some women there don't use their bikini top :)

reviews.title: nice place
reviews.text: To get back on topic: We couldn't believe that we could get so much (good!) food en cocktails for that price! Especially now with the low dollar rate you better take the 9h flight to go there. In South-Europe you really can't have the same for that price. I ate everything (fruit, sushi, all kinds of salads, fish, meat...). I tasted very good and I didn't have any stomach problems.

description: Directly on the beautiful, sandy beach of Bavaro (Punta Cana). Colourful Caribbean flair. Water sports galore. All inclusive (generous, varied buffets for all meals).
